intro: Anthemis anthemoides, commonly known as the golden marguerite, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are surrounded by white ray florets, creating a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Anthemis anthemoides is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
